verses.text: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah , who \add was\add* sixteen years old , and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.\f + \fr 26.1 \ft Uzziah: or, Azariah\f*
He built Eloth , and restored it to Judah , after that the king slept with his fathers.
Sixteen years old \add was\add* Uzziah when he began to reign , and he reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also \add was\add* Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that his father Amaziah did.

And he sought God in the days of Zechariah , who had understanding in the visions of God : and as long as he sought the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, God made him to prosper.\f + \fr 26.5 \ft in the visions…: Heb. in the seeing of God\f*

And he went forth and warred against the Philistines , and brake down the wall of Gath , and the wall of Jabneh , and the wall of Ashdod , and built cities about Ashdod , and among the Philistines.\f + \fr 26.6 \ft about…: or, in the country of Ashdod\f*
And God helped him against the Philistines , and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gur-baal , and the Mehunims.

And the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah : and his name spread abroad \add even\add* to the entering in of Egypt ; for he strengthened \add himself\add* exceedingly.\f + \fr 26.8 \ft spread…: Heb. went\f*
Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate , and at the valley gate , and at the turning \add of the wall\add*, and fortified them.\f + \fr 26.9 \ft fortified: or, repaired\f*

Also he built towers in the desert , and digged many wells : for he had much cattle , both in the low country , and in the plains : husbandmen \add also\add*, and vine dressers in the mountains , and in Carmel : for he loved husbandry.\f + \fr 26.10 \ft digged…: or, cut out many cisterns\f*\f + \fr 26.10 \ft Carmel: or, fruitful fields\f*\f + \fr 26.10 \ft husbandry: Heb. ground\f*

Moreover Uzziah had an host of fighting men , that went out to war by bands , according to the number of their account by the hand of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler , under the hand of Hananiah , \add one\add* of the king’s captains.
The whole number of the chief of the fathers of the mighty men of valour \add were\add* two thousand and six hundred.

And under their hand \add was\add* an army , three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred , that made war with mighty power , to help the king against the enemy.\f + \fr 26.13 \ft an army: Heb. the power of an army\f*

And Uzziah prepared for them throughout all the host shields , and spears , and helmets , and habergeons , and bows , and slings \add to cast\add* stones.\f + \fr 26.14 \ft slings…: Heb. stones of slings\f*

And he made in Jerusalem engines , invented by cunning men , to be on the towers and upon the bulwarks , to shoot arrows and great stones withal. And his name spread far abroad ; for he was marvellously helped , till he was strong.\f + \fr 26.15 \ft spread: Heb. went forth\f* \p

¶ But when he was strong , his heart was lifted up to \add his\add* destruction : for he transgressed against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* his God , and went into the temple of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
And Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore priests of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add that were\add* valiant men :

And they withstood Uzziah the king , and said unto him, \add It appertaineth\add* not unto thee, Uzziah , to burn incense unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, but to the priests the sons of Aaron , that are consecrated to burn incense : go out of the sanctuary ; for thou hast trespassed ; neither \add shall it be\add* for thine honour from the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God.

Then Uzziah was wroth , and \add had\add* a censer in his hand to burn incense : and while he was wroth with the priests , the leprosy even rose up in his forehead before the priests in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, from beside the incense altar.

And Azariah the chief priest , and all the priests , looked upon him, and, behold, he \add was\add* leprous in his forehead , and they thrust him out from thence; yea, himself hasted also to go out , because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had smitten him.

And Uzziah the king was a leper unto the day of his death , and dwelt in a several house , \add being\add* a leper ; for he was cut off from the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and Jotham his son \add was\add* over the king’s house , judging the people of the land.\f + \fr 26.21 \ft several: Heb. free\f* \p
¶ Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah , first and last , did Isaiah the prophet , the son of Amoz , write.

So Uzziah slept with his fathers , and they buried him with his fathers in the field of the burial which \add belonged\add* to the kings ; for they said , He \add is\add* a leper : and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
